newsitem.title: USA: Gas producers, consumers fear U.S. FERC rate shift.
newsitem.headline: Gas producers, consumers fear U.S. FERC rate shift.

text.p: U.S. natural gas producers and consumers expressed concern Friday about the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's approval this week of a major pipeline company rate agreement which avoided the commission's standard rate structure.
The FERC Wednesday backed a rate settlement between Tenneco Inc's Tennessee Gas Pipeline Co and its shippers, resolving several issues on cost of service and rate designs.
While FERC has permitted some pipelines to negotiate rates with individual shippers, this was the first time it approved a broad settlement deviating from the standard rate design.
